title.narrative: Organizational and technical strengthening of APROCACAHO

description.narrative: This seven-months project with partner APROCACAHO in Honduras aims to strengthen their capacity as a second tier cocoa farmers organization with a total budget of $20,000. The project will benefit 772 farmers members of APROCACAHO member organizations and indirectly benefit 3474 members of those cocoa producing households. Participating households will benefit through improved services received from APROCACAHO including technical assistance, information, and marketing services, and greater representation within the organization for improved advocacy on behalf of member cooperatives with government and development entities investing in the sector. The project also complements investments by Christian Aid and Vecoma in APROCACAHO over the same period, forming part of a broader initiative with additional results we will be contributing to. This project is strategic for LWR in the Central America Region in reaching scale for several reasons. First, it maintains a presence for LWR in the cocoa sector in Honduras where we have gained great recognition for our supporting and convening role in the sector with relatively little on the ground investment through the DoS project. Both COSUDE and USAID Proparque have included us in conversations about investments in the sector though we have not yet obtained funding from either of these sources for reasons related to their funding and implementation mechanisms. Second, it allows LWR to maintain its regional presence by giving LWR feet on the ground in Honduras in anticipation of regional opportunities for funding, ongoing collaboration with USAID FtF Regional program led by RUTA, field testing the interactive toolkit under development with Grameen, and ongoing support of regional initiatives such as Cocoa of Excellence where LWR has been a leader in the region.

participating-org.narrative: Asociación de Productores de Cacao de Honduras (APROCACAHO)
